thread.title: Wakefield QB offered by NC State
thread.title_full: Wakefield QB offered by NC State

title: Wakefield QB offered by NC State
text:
Wakefield QB offered by NC State 
Posted 1:01 p.m. today Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters By Nick Stevens 
Raleigh, N.C. â€” Wakefield High School quarterback Matt McKay has picked up his first college offer, and it comes from North Carolina State University. 
McKay confirmed to HighSchoolOT.com on Tuesday that the Wolfpack have extended an offer. 
"This offer means a lot to me and my family, and it's a blessing," McKay said. "I really feel like all the work I have been putting in has been showing and it's time to work harder." 
McKay said he likes the fact that his first offer is from a local Atlantic Coast Conference school. 
At 6-foot-3 and 170 pounds, McKay has completed 111-of-224 passes for 1,450 yards and 13 touchdowns in eight games, according to MaxPreps.com. He has also posted 704 rushing yards on 128 attempts, scoring seven times. 
Wakefield currently sits in second place in the Cap 8 Conference behind two-time defending regional champion Wake Forest. The Wolverines are 6-2 overall and 3-1 in the Cap 8. 
"I would like to thank my team, coaches and everyone that trained me, because I wouldn't have gotten this opportunity without them, and I'm thankful for them all," McKay said. 
McKay and Wakefield will return to the field on Friday night at 7 p.m. when they travel to Broughton. 
Follow Nick Stevens on Twitter @NickStevensHSOT
